text:
The Park Ranger also noted that mold was growing in some areas around Ghost Lake. To better understand the mold growth, she left a loaf bread out on the counter. For several days she collected data on the amount of growth of the mold on the loaf of bread.

She wrote the equation m = 50(3d) to model the exponential growth pattern of the mold. In this equation, m is the area of the mold in square millimeters after d days. She used the equation to find the following information:

  • Area of the mold at the start of the data collection
  • The growth factor
  • The area of the mold after 5 days
  • The day the area of the mold reached 6,400 square millimeters

  1. Explain how she could use the equation to find each piece of information.
  2. How is the growth factor and initial population for an exponential function represented in an equation that represents the function?
